As a landed noble, however minor, your future is all but assured. You settle in your holdfast at {s7}, administrating the village and fields, adjudicating the local courts and fulfilling your obligations to your liege lord. Occasionally your liege calls you to muster and command in his campaigns, but these stints are brief, and you never truly return to the adventuring of your younger days. You have already made your fortune. With your own hall and holdings, you've few wants that your personal wealth and the income of your lands cannot afford you.

There is no question that you've done very well for yourself. Your extensive holdings and adventuring wealth are enough to guarantee you a rich and easy life for the rest of your days. Retiring to your noble seat in {s8}, you exchange adventure for politics, and you soon establish yourself as a considerable power in your liege lord's kingdom. With intrigue to busy yourself with, your own forests to hunt, a hall to feast in and a hundred fine war stories to tell, you have little trouble making the best of the years that follow.

As a reward for your competent and loyal service, your liege lord decrees that you be given a hereditary title, joining the major nobility of the realm. Soon you complete your investitute as baron of {s7}, and you become one of your liege's close advisors and adjutants. Your renown garners you much subtle pull and influence as well as overt political power. Now you spend your days playing the games of power, administering your great fiefs, and recounting the old times of adventure and glory.

Though you started from humble beginnings, your liege lord holds you in high esteem, and a ripple of shock passes through the realm when he names you to the hereditary title of {count/countess} of {s9}. Vast fiefs and fortunes are now yours to rule. You quickly become your liege's most trusted advisor, almost his equal and charged with much of the running of his realm, and you sit a throne in your own splendourous palace as one of the most powerful figures in Calradia.

I am Bolzog the Gifted, Setter of Bones, Closer of Cuts, and Shaman of Healing. If you go to war for The Eye, you will no doubt have one or other of your little fellows cut about a bit by pale-faced foresters or the horse-lovers. Now, -nar-nar-nar! - Orcs are easy to replace, Oh Great Leader, but can you replace a Warg? A Giant? A Cave Troll? Shi-shi! No! You need me, the Great Bolzog!

Well now, it is the stranger who should declare himself first. Nevertheless, I am Varfang of the Balcoth kin... I can tell that you have not yet heard the songs or tales of my land that speak the name of the Balcoth, for the very name would check your courage and fill your heart with woe.

They call me Dímborn and I work in the woods. It is nice there. I like the woods. Many trees in the woods. I like trees. I've worked in the woods all my life, because I am strong and because I like trees.

You should know that I am an Ithilien Ranger of Dúnedain descent and valor. I know much of tracking and scouting and my skill with bow and sword is known to the orc. I can also train any soul that's willing to fight the coming Shadow.
Minas Tirith bekçisi olarak, Beyaz Şehri'nde düzen tutmak ve efendim Steward'a hizmet etmek için eğitildim.
Ben Batı Emnet'in bir binicisiyim - beni arkada bırakıp Isen ford'larında devriyeye çıktılar. Davranışlarının yeşil bayrağa layık olduğunu biliyorum, fakat birçoğunun geri dönmemesinden korkuyorum.

Ben asil bir aileden geliyorum ve küçüklüğümden beri nedime olarak Leydi Eowyn'a hizmet etmişimdir. Babam bize bir gün Rohan'ın kalkan kardeşleri olmamız için erkek kardeşlerimizle beraber talim yapmamıza izin verecek bilgeliğe sahipti. Böylece savaşmayı öğrendim.
Lord Elrond beni Lord Celeborn'a göndererek, Rhovanion'un bu bölümünde Savaşta ihtiyaç duyduğu gibi yardım ve tavsiye vermeye çağırdı.

I like to walk the hidden paths in our beautiful forest. Sometimes I move quietly through the trees and observe the habits of the many woodland animals. The song of a rare bird, the nesting of a wild boar are as beautiful to me as the clash of weapons and great walls are to the Edain.
I helped improve the Erebor defenses and trained some younger dwarven folk, under the direction of my venerated father Dwalin, as is our custom.
I have treated my King Brand for constipation, a common malaise affecting men going to war. A light brew of wormwood, and both the bowels and the mind are put at ease.

So I said to myself, 'Gulm, you want end up as carrion?' and I answered, 'No'.^Next battle, I fell back pretending I was injured. Then, with no one watching, I fell upon my sergeant! Ar! It's only 'cause my nose was snotty. An' what good is it wearing my nose out on stones anyhow? Nar! It was those filthy Uruks! Those cursed peaching sneakthiefs! I only lost the scent through giving way to them. They messed up the scent back there, pinching anything they found, and stomping all round the place before I could get there.

And those Nazgul give me the creeps. And they skin the body off you as soon as look at you, and leave you all cold in the dark on the other side. But He likes 'em; they're His favourites nowadays, so it's no use grumbling. I tell you, it's no game serving in the city. I'd like to try somewhere where there's none of 'em.

I saw of late the word of the Dark Lord spread among my kin, and in their hearts and minds his will crept. Most were drawn to his darkness, and in place of their courage grew an insatiable lust for slaughter so that when their ears heard his call few puppets were so willing to answer.

There is much change in a man who rides the tumult of the winds and seas of the Belfalas waters, and those yet to battle her will are but children. For stout men are they who meet her tempest and ride her storm. I have laid eyes on her darkest tide and yet remain her master.

Many moons ago, when I was just a fresh little thing, my Grandsire led the tribe down into the mines, where the dwarves had recently died. A Fire Wraith had passed through, and it was comfortable and warm. We prospered, but every so often some cruel adventurer, or Dwarf hero, would come and kill and maim us in our peaceful tunnels. My hands learned to close the wound of sword or axe, and my mind learned to see the outline of bone and sinew below any hide. These days, I can work a potion or set a break with equal skill.

The Balcoth were a fierce race of men from my home land, slaughtered by these westerlings to all but a few men. Chased down like beasts of burden as food for their blades. The blood spilt by those blades is the same blood that flows within me, for within me their house continues.
You can make many things out of the trees, you know. It's what I do. I work with trees and make things out of trees. Sometimes bushes also. But I like trees more.

However, I fear we are hopelessly outnumbered here in Ithilien and we won't last long without reinforcements or bolder action by our Steward. I might as well help where my actions would account for more, if my Captain Faramir gives me leave.

However important my duty here is, I'm quite anxious to see real combat and... elves and talking trees and oliphaunts! Orkların atları yediğini duydum. İğrenç yaratıklar! ayrıca esirleride yiyiyorlarmış. buda kötü elbette.
There are no horses finer than Rohan's. Even the Elves get their horses from us!
If you can heal men, please treat my horses with just as much care should they be wounded.
Bring me eight Sumpter Horses, he says... after the seven he asked for yesterday.  Makes you wonder.
Gondor prefers sturdier horses. Our riders enjoy speed. The Elves get only the best. And our enemies steal them!
I've seen breeds of the desert mare and Variag horse. Rohan horses are clearly superiour but require a more experienced rider to handle.
Wargs are slower than horses but can turn faster. They are also quite fragile compared to a well-bred warhorse.
Armies march on Rohan with pikes and spears set against our fine horsemen. The traitor Saruman will cut down the whole Fangorn forest equipping his armies before this war is over.
Krallıktaki en iyi atlı olmak için, en iyi atları sürmekten başlaman gerekir.
Gondor'da gördüğün atların çoğu bizden gönderildi. Onlar Ağır zırhlarını taşıyabilen, biraz daha güçlü, ancak biraz daha yavaş atları tercih ederler.

We say in Rohan that a horse is like a man. That if a horse is good it is like a man is good, and that if a horse is bad, is like a man is bad. And if a horse is hungry is like a man is hungry, and if a horse is sad is like if a man is sad. And we say if a horse is happy is like when a man is happy. We say if a horse is angry is like if man is angry. We say if a horse walk is like when a man walk, we say if a horse is old is like when a man is old, and we say if horse is young is like when a man is young. And the same we say if a horse is old is like when a man is old. And if a horse small, is like when a man's small.
Saruman'ın orkları kötü ama çok fazla koruma giymiyorlar. İyi bir balta darbesi için uygun değiller.
Our throwing axes and spears may seem bulky, but how many chances do you have to throw a missile before you ride down the foe? Make it count by throwing something with some heft.
Hitting an orc with an arrow loosed from horseback looks difficult because it is, but the price of charging a rank of long pikes is higher.
Gondor practices archery. We practice horse archery. Dunlendings practice neither.
Saruman'ın orklarının birçoğu ölümcül okçular. Birçoğu değil. Bilge bir süvari komutanı kimin hangisi olduğunu keşfetmek için beklememelidir.
We are all friends here. Or should be; for the laughter of Mordor will be our only reward, if we quarrel.
Long we have tended our beasts and our fields, built our houses, wrought our tools, or ridden away to help in the wars of Minas Tirith. And that we called the life of Men, the way of the world.
Gondor has no king and enemies are at the doorstep. The shadow grows in the east. Things do not look good.
In Gondor there is nothing under the sun we don't make, build, or grow in some quantity. But for how much longer?
Mordor is a dry, infertile land. What do the creatures there eat? Surely not one another? Or maybe...
We toil our lands, as we have done for generations. Our past is glorious and brave, but our future looks uncertain.
The Shadow's resources for war seem limitless, but they are borne on the backs of a vast pool of slave labour.
We know of the elves in the north, but nowadays noone gets to see them anymore.

I would see the White Tree in flower again in the courts of the kings, and the Silver Crown return, and Minas Tirith in peace: Minas Anor again as of old, full of light, high and fair, beautiful as a queen among other queens.

Why does Umbar keep invading us? Their Corsairs would have profited far more from trading with us. What plunder could match the riches they'd have hauled away selling old Numenorian artifacts to Gondorian nobles?

War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.
Gil-galad bir Elf Kralıydı. Harperler hakkında şarkılar söylerler: Dağlar ve deniz arasındaki Krallıkların içinde, adil ve özgür olan son kişi.
Dol Guldur mu? hiç duymamıştım.
Moria mı? Cüce madenleri orada, değil mi?
Don't tell anyone I said this, but I think Prince Imrahil should perhaps become king. Lord Denethor is a noble man, but Gondor has faded much during his reign. And not only since his older son left.
People say the Nine rode out of Minas Morgul again. I wish we had more brave captains like Boromir to lead our men into battle against such ancient foes.

The Southerners are pushing us out of Harondor. They've been raiding us hard for some time. I wish I could walk safely through the green fields of Lebennin again. But we are told 'No.', our soldiers are to protect the heart of the realm.
My friend's cousin is a bowman in service of Hirluin the Fair. They have by far the best looking uniforms, if you ask me.
There is a strange black rock near Erech. I went to see it once with my father. People say it's laid over a chamber where the last son of the sea kings sleeps. I think it's just a rock.
We are truth-speakers, we Gondorians. We boast seldom, and then perform, or die in the attempt.
Cücelerin hiç arkadaşı olup olmadığını soruyorlar. Elbette arkadaşlarımız var. ama biz onları sevmiyoruz.
Orcs? Pfft! Axe-grease, all they are.
What's that you're wearing? It doesn't look like it would protect you from a bee sting. And it looks funny.
Of course we can ride horses. We just don't want to!
Bugger off! We don't need your sort around here, the orcs are bad enough.
Who are you calling short?
You should see the caves of Hornburg. If we could only mine all the gems there...
No word from our brothers in Moria for a while now. I bet they just want to keep all the riches to themselves!

Elves? What have the elves ever done for us? Ok, healing arts, but besides that? Ok, some smithing techniques, but anything else? Ok, they fight the Shadow, but besides what have they really ever done for us, I ask you?
A flagon of ale, a roast pig, a girl with a thick beard and I'm happy!
Well, Brian, I'm opening a mine! What? Ugh? Well, Brian, I'm opening a mine!
We, Dwarves always build more than one entry into our mines. And then there's the secret ones too.
Strange are the ways of men.

*humms quietly* Kill the Men! Kill the Elves! Save the gold for ourselves!

Küreye güvenme Saruman!

Uruk glob ishi krimp shar-kûk.

Come not between the Nazgûl and his prey!

Crank up yer spotting if you don't want to get ambushed in Ithilien. Those damn greenhoods...

at-adamlar yiğecektir! Bubhosh!

büyücü üstat güçlü uruk-hai hazırlıyor!

I don't trust those little mountain orc swines. Isengarders will win this war, with or without them.
Beyaz El! Bizim mücadelemize dağ kurtçukları göndermenin anlamı nedir, sadece yarım eğitimli! Lanet goblinler ve Kuzey orklar!
I'd tickle some prisoners with my knife. Sometimes you need to make those miserable rats squeak!
There's only one thing the maggots and rats of Lugbúrz can do: they can see like gimlets in the dark.
We're cutting down the forest, but many orcs that go in, never come out.
Where there's a whip there's a way.
Ride like the wind of the steppes!
The Dwarves are greedy and vile. And Dale-men help them exploit and cheat us.
Three wizards came to our lands a while ago. I wonder what they are up to.
Our lands are vast and sparsely populated. But we know how to survive there.
We used to trade with Elves and Dwarves our wine and pipe-weed from the fertile lands. But they cheat and lie!
Our cousins from Khand prefer to fight on foot, but we know being on a horse is better.
Gondor lejyonlarını bir defa mağlup ettik, Bir kez daha edeceğiz!
Biz ölüm için savaşırız! Asla geri çekilme,asla dönme ve koşma! Geriye adım atma!
A red dawn has risen in the east. A red dusk awaits the west!
Elven women? Nah. Too fragile!
Each of my sons has already brought me a head of an enemy. And my daughter the testicles of one. Ha ha ha!
Orcs are filthy beasts with no skill or courage. They have no place on the field of battle.
What's best in life? To crush your enemies, see them driven before you, and to hear the lamentation of their women.
We won't rest until we are avenged and the strawheads are on their knees!
Rohirrim piçleri geceleri kendi atları ile arkadaşlar! Ha ha ha!
Strawheads will cough out our land! Together with their blood! Gah!
Death to the Forgoil! Death to the Strawheads! Death to the robbers from the North!
They call it Rohan now, but it's our ancestral land! We will avenge our forfathers and chase off the dirty land-thieves.
Don't let the Forgoil catch you, or they will torture and burn you alive!
We are the bloodlust of the wolf and the strength of the boar!
Forgoil think we are savage and stupid. Let's see what they think after their horsemen meet our pikemen.
Isengard's crows will peck out Strawheads' eyes, Dunland's wolves will bite their throats.
I caught and killed a wolf with my bare hands. I will snap a horse-man's neck like a twig! Grrr!
Our chief found an old bronze sword in a barrow. He bent it and threw it in the marsh. Spirits of the hills will be on our side for sure. It is the old way.
My forefathers fought with Freca and later Wulf against the bloodied Forgoil. We remember their courage.
The woods are vast and all manner of creatures live inside.
Wild bees make the best honey!
Elves of the woods are elusive, but kind. Dwarves from the mountains are loud and cheerful. Men of Dale are hardworking.
We see many strange beasts passing through our lands.
Tüm gece uyuyacağım ve tüm gün çalışacağım!
Kötülük dağlardan sızıyor.
Büyük orman artık eskisi gibi değil!
Baltanın gücü ağzında değil, sapındandır.

Rohan'ın adamları bizim akrabalarımızdır, ayıları kanımızdır, goblinleri avımız!
Turn into bears? Of course we don't. Who told you that? Ha ha ha!
Beorn Büyük bir insan. Hayır, insan değil, bir dev!
*GROWLS*   Do you have any honey?
Don't wander off alone in the mountains! Bears and wolves stay away from larger groups of men. But hunger, or as some say - shadow spirits, may drive them close enough to attack you.
O Lórien! The Winter comes, the bare and leafless Day; The leaves are falling in the stream, the River flows away.
Lady Galadriel'e hiçbir kötülük söyleme! Bir adam ona getirmediği sürece, onda ve bu topraklarda hiç kötülük yoktur. O zaman dikkat etmeye çalış!
The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater.

Good and ill have not changed since yesteryear; nor are they one thing among Elves and Dwarves, and another among Men. It is a man's part to discern them, as much in the Golden Wood as in his own house.
Often does hatred hurt itself!
Antik büyü, Lothlórien'i korur; Karanlığın gücü henüz buna karşı koymaya yetmez.
Nathlo i nathal! You are safe within the golden woods. Posto vae - rest now, eat and drink. If you must leave then, carry with you a memory of how Lorien once was.
It is said that the sea calls to everyone, sooner or later. I too shall hear the gulls one day, leave Laurelindórenan for good. I Harthon an lend and.
Av-'osto - do not be afraid! More than our grey cloaks protect us from the enemy here.
May the blessing of Elves and Men and all Free Folk go with you.
May the stars shine upon your faces!
He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.
We must take a hard road, a road unforeseen. There lies our hope, if hope it be.
Despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt. We do not.
Even after the coldest winter flowers do spring. And after the longest night, comes a new dawn.
So many had gathered when last I rode to war. The light of the drawing of our swords was like a fire in a field of reeds. So few have left Imladris now.
Áva rucë! The Eldar have taken arms to fight the enemy alongside brave Edain once more.  Perhaps for the last time, who knows? We sing of war, of fire and the end of the Night.

I see the men from the East ride under the Dark Lord's banner and it is as though I watched their ancestors again - waves of horsemen shattering upon the gleaming shieldwall of the Last Alliance. If only the memory of Edain was as long as ours.
An Elven-maid there was of old, /A shining star by day: /Her mantle white was hemmed with gold, /Her shoes of silver-grey.

Time does not tarry ever, but change and growth is not in all things and places alike. For the Elves the world moves, and it moves both very swift and very slow. Swift, because they themselves change little, and all else fleets by: it is a grief to them. Slow, because they do not count the running years, not for themselves.
Darkness and evil creep over these once beautiful woods. Unless they are stopped, they will smother all hope, all light.
Quick and nimble, quiet and precise, we can yet keep the Darkness at bay. But how much longer?
Shhh, no dhínen! There may be orcs lurking around. We must be on guard!
*stares at you, obviously annoyed by your presence*
Oduleg hi am man theled? We need to know your purpose here. Sorcerer's spies are everywhere.
Edain of Dale make intricate toys these days! They've learnt much from the Naugrim.

The shadow of Dol Guldur is spreading. Dark creatures have been seen in the woods, our outposts attacked, hunters disappear and are never seen again. Our patrols now number at least 35 soldiers, we have grown that fearful!
Öncelerde burada bir ejderha vardı, ama şimdi...
As if the orcs coming from the north weren't bad enough, now the hordes from the east are upon us!
Ever since the defeat of the dragon, we know how to look for the enemy's weak spot.
Easterlings will never make it past us and our dwarven allies.
Have you ever seen the sun rise over the Long lake? The colours used to make my heart sing. But now all I see is a red dawn. A bad omen.
Dwarves are a bit too attached to treasures. We still don't know what to think of Thorin Oakenshield.
The men of Rohan are our cousins and our own language is very similar to theirs.
Esgaroth got its name from an Elven word for reeds, because of its reed banks. Did you know that?
The dragon was a sort of a monster noone wants to see ever again.
Our prosperity comes from trade with the Dwarves and the Elves. But it's hard to bargain with Dwarves. Very little profit there.
The Black Snake will strike swift and deadly.
By the Serpent! Our beasts will trample Gondorians into the dirt.
Odum vermajál otí verthaba av daranaja-e-jatánus!
There is much gold and gems in Gondor. And even more in the lands beyond.
We will catch many western weaklings and sacrifice them to the Serpent God.
Corsairs have their uses, they sail well, but are rowdy and unclean in appearance and sneaky in behaviour.
I'd never set foot on a ship. Corsairs can have all the seas as far as I am concerned.
Warriors of Khand are fierce and fearless, but their strategy is too simple.
I'm counting on good loot in the West. We were promised it. Then I can return home and run my carpet shop in peace.
Keep away from the Mumakil. They are ill-tempered beasts and will squash you in an instant.
In Harad we have deserts and jungles, mountains and sea. Our peoples are as diverse as our lands and as numerous as the grains of sand.
Many knights from Harondor prefer sabres over straight blades. They're quite good for cutting down running peasants, but you need a spear or a good sword to penetrate strong armour.
My blood brother signed up with the Karka - he's a scout now. Riders of 'The Fang' lead a dangerous life, but it is good experience for young hot-headed boys.
Don't ever pick a fight with the Lion brotherhood! Their reputation is well earned.
I wish we had more weapons made of black iron. Many still have to manage with bronze, some even with wooden clubs and javelins of black glass, running into battle naked.
Take warm lands from men we come!
Sharkû promised warm caves.
Enough hiding in the cold mountains! Now we march into warm lands of men.
We saw a slimy skulker in our mountain tunnels, but could never catch him. He just disappeared when we got close.
The Isengarders think they're something special because the old man is equipping them.
We will burn the villages of men to keep us warm.
Manlings will feel the frostbite we will bring to them. And afterwards the fire. Ha ha ha!
Azog and Bolg almost defeated dwarves, elves and manlings last time. But bird-monsters and bear-men saved them. *spit*
Dwarf-flesh is tough and stringy. Man-flesh is better.
Bear-men came from the woods and ate Boldush. Bad luck for Boldush! Ha ha ha!
Some moved to Moria, much room there. But also Ghâsh in the deep. Best stay away!
Davulları duyunca, koş ve saklan!
Ghâsh derinlerde!
Doom! Doom! Doom! Davullar derinlerden geliyor.
Moria büyük, ama cüceler artık burada saklanamıyor.
Cüceler çok derin kazdı. Bizim için her şey daha iyi. Ha ha ha!
Moria'da birçok tünel var. hepsinden gidemeyiz.
Some manlings and dwarves sneaked past our sentries in the mines a while ago. We doubled the watch since.
Cüceler buraya birdaha ayak basamayacak! Hiç bir zaman!
When we gather enough troops, we will go and burn down woods of elves.
Moria'da fazla yemek yok. Biz açız. İnsanları ve elfleri yakalamalısın!
Some go to the forest in the south. None come out.
All the seas will belong to the black sails!
There's no Gondor ships left to sink, now we go plunder inland.
Umbar is our fate! And it will be Gondor's too.
Gondorians can't sail! They've got land-legs.
We've killed Gondorian kings in the past. Now they don't even have a king for us to kill.
The sneaky Gondorians burned our fleet years ago. Now it's Gondor that'll burn.
Nothing the sea can throw at us frightens a corsair. But we heard some disturbing rumours about abominations on land.
We will spill over Gondor like a giant wave and reclaim our long lost lands.
Haradrim don't drink rum. Did you know that? We like some, to steady the harpoon hand.
I saw some Variags of Khand fighting. I wouldn't want to be facing them in battle. It is a good thing they are on our side.
Kavga, ne kadar kanlı olursa olsun, kavga demektir. Ancak geri çekilme en büyük utanç!
Kılıçlarımızı bir kere çizdiğimizde kan bulması lazım!
The ground trembles under our heavy cataphract cavalry, but our enemies tremble at the mere mention of us!
This time we left the Wainriders behind, our attack will catch the enemies off guard.
We are the Variags of Khand, the fiercest warriors anywhere!
Rhun warriors are fierce too, but they fight on horseback, we rather maul our enemies on foot.
We have fought Gondorians in the past, this time we will finish them for good!
The West is weak and decadent. They have no warrior spirit. They will fall to our swords and axes.
Bizler altın yada köleler için değil, Bizler onur ve şan için savaşırız!
The men of the West are arrogant, they do not know what might they are facing!
Bazen Rhun, Mordor ve Harad la ticaret yaparız. Bazen de savaşırız. Bu bizim kanımızda var.
Have you made your warrior mask yet? You'll need one soon! If the enemy can't see your face, his spirit won't be able to find you.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king.
Orklar geceleri daha iyi dövüşürler, ancak gündüz zayıflarlar.
Uruk-Hai farklıdır, orklar gibi güneş ışığı korkusu yok !
Always after a defeat and a respite, the Shadow takes another shape and grows again.
The Dead Marshes... a land defiled, diseased beyond all healing.
The Shadow that bred can only mock, it cannot make: not real new things of its own. I don't think it gave life to the orcs, it only ruined them and twisted them.
Greenwood it used to be called and full of elves it was. Greatest of the forests of the Northern world. But now it's Mirkwood. Crawling with all manner of evil creatures.
The Argonath, The Pillars of the Kings, great guardians of the old northern border of Gondor.

Fight horseman with pike, footman with arrow and archer with shield!
Large statues of weaklings on the big river will not stand much longer.
Efsaneler, Fangornda ağaçların birbirleriyle konuştuklarını söyler.
Anduin'de, büyük heykellerin bulunduğu bir yerde özel bir yer olduğunu söylüyorlar.
Ölü Sazların ortasında ölülerin hayatta olduğu söylentileri dolaşıyor.
Orklardan farklı yaratıklar Mirkwood çevresinde gezinirler.
Fangorn, kaçınılması gereken bir ormandır. Olağandışı şeyler orda gerçekleşir.
Son zamanlarda ilginç bir şey duymadım.
Şimdi acele etme...

Kralın Adamı

You have become highly esteemed by King Theoden of Rohan and your status has risen among the men of Rohan as a result. The cost to recruit Rohirrim men has been reduced and you may now attempt to give orders to the armies of the Riddermark.
Barbarların Şampiyonu
You have become highly esteemed by the barbarian tribes serving Sauron as a result of your impressive displays in the arena. You may now recruit barbarians at reduced cost.
Kutsanmış
You sense that you have been blessed by powers from beyond the sea, and perhaps further away still. You do not know why this has happened or what it may mean but you are certain that it is so.
Saygılı
You have acquired a reputation for reverence and wisdom. Men and Elves are more likely to listen to your counsel.
Merhametli

You have aquired a reputation for merciful treatment towards the evil men who serve the Enemy. Many of the hardened men who serve you are conflicted by your behavior and suffer a morale penalty. Among the wise, however, your mercy is seen as evidence of high character and you recieve an influence bonus.
Yiğitlik

You have aquired a reputation for bravery in the face of great danger. Your courage is spoken of in both quiet taverns and the halls of the wise. Your deeds inspire your men and they recieve a weekly morale bonus.
Yemin Tutan
You have sworn grim oaths and lived to see them fulfilled. Subsequently you have aquired a reputation as a man of his word. You receive a weekly influence bonus.
Yemin bozan

You have sworn grim oaths and failed to see them through to their conclusion. Subsequently you have aquired a reputation as a man whose passion outstrips his prowess. You receive a weekly influence penalty.
Ork çukur Şampiyonu

You have become renowned as a brutal warrior who was able to survive the cruelest of the orcish fighting contests. Such strength is both respected and feared by your black hearted followers and they now receive a weekly morale bonus.
Çapulcu
You have aquired a reputation for leaving behind wanton destruction wherever you travel. Such behavior is valued by the dark powers you serve and your receive a weekly influence bonus.
Lanetli
You sense that you have drawn the ire of powers beyond the sea. Your followers sense this doom as well and fear being around you. They receive a weekly morale penalty.
Gizli
You have developed uncanny skill in the art of stealthy infiltration. You receive a bonus to your stealth rating when undertaking such missions.
Vahşi Savaşçı

After many battles where you eschewed the use of armor your ferocious will has become like iron. In battles where you are gravely wounded you will receive a health bonus once per battle. This will not restore you to full strength but may keep you going long after others would have succumbed to their wounds.

Okçu Kaptanı

Süvari Kaptanı

Komuta Sesi
Your experience with commanding men in the field has lent you an air of authority. The influence cost to give orders to armies in the field has been reduced.
Düşman Çekici

Düşmanın büyük kaptanlarından birçoğunu öldürdükten sonra korkunç bir savaşçı olarak ün kazanmış olursunuz. Komutanlığındaki askerler şimdi haftalık bir moral bonusu alıyor. Deneyimleriniz savaştaki becerinizi de geliştirdi.
Savaş Yaraları

You have suffered horrific wounds during your many campaigns yet you still live to tell the tale. Your scarred and knotted flesh now conspires with hard experience to increase your resistance to injury. While others may find your appearance somewhat shocking your followers consider it an affirmation of your battle experience. They subsequently receive a weekly morale bonus.
Fell Beast

Your hide is riven with the knotted scars of countless battles and your evil will is likewise hard and unyielding. Even by the standards of orc, uruk and troll-kind you are judged a fell and dangerous beast. Those who serve you cry your name in joy when you take to the field. You are an avatar of war itself and there is little you fear.
